intro: Ouratea lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in suitable habitats.
